      • doCancel

        public void doCancel()
        Description copied from interface: RunnableEntity
        Stops the entity's activity and declares it as canceled.

        If this entity owns RunnableEntity children, then they must also be canceled.

        Nothing is done if this entity is already terminated (if RunnableEntity.isTerminated() returns true).

        Specified by:
        doCancel in interface RunnableEntity
        Overrides:
        doCancel in class JobDefault

      • doFail

        public void doFail()
        Description copied from interface: RunnableEntity
        Stops the entity's activity and declares it as failed.

        If this entity owns RunnableEntity children, then they must also be declared as failed.

        Nothing is done if this entity is already terminated (if RunnableEntity.isTerminated() returns true).

        Specified by:
        doFail in interface RunnableEntity
        Overrides:
        doFail in class JobDefault

      • doPause

        public void doPause()
        Description copied from interface: RunnableEntity
        Stops the entity's activity and declares it as paused.

        Specified by:
        doPause in interface RunnableEntity
        Overrides:

      • doRestart

        public void doRestart()
        Description copied from interface: RunnableEntity
        Reinitializes the entity and restarts it from the beginning.

        Use this method to start again an entity after it is terminated. So, unlike RunnableEntity.doStart() this method will not throw an exception if this entity is already terminated.

        Make sure that RunnableEntity.canRestart() returns true before calling this method or you will get an exception.

        If this entity owns RunnableEntity children, then they must be canceled.

        Specified by:
        doRestart in interface RunnableEntity
        Overrides:
        doRestart in class JobDefault

      • doStart

        public void doStart()
        Description copied from interface: RunnableEntity
        Starts or continues the entity's activity and declares it as running.

        Make sure that RunnableEntity.canStart() returns true before calling this method or you will get an exception.

        If this entity owns RunnableEntity children, then they must also be started.

        Specified by:
        doStart in interface RunnableEntity
        Overrides:
        doStart in class JobDefault

      • getRamZone

        public RamZone getRamZone()
        Description copied from interface: Workload
        Returns this workload's RamZone.

        If there is no RamZone associated with the current workload, then one is created automatically.

        Specified by:
        getRamZone in interface Workload
        Returns:
        this workload's RamZone

      • getStorageFile

        public StorageFile getStorageFile()
        Description copied from interface: Workload
        Returns current workload's StorageFile.

        By default, a random file is selected among all current user's files.
        And, if the current user has no attached files, then the default is null. Current user is the owner of the parent virtual machine.

        All tasks that works on StorageFiles will be given this file.

        Specified by:
        getStorageFile in interface Workload
        Returns:
        current workload's StorageFile

      • setStorageFile

        public void setStorageFile(StorageFile storageFile)
        Description copied from interface: Workload
        Updates current workload's StorageFile.
        Specified by:
        setStorageFile in interface Workload

      • getRemoteJob

        public Job getRemoteJob()
        Description copied from interface: Workload
        Returns current workload's remote Job.

        By default, a job is created on one of the current user's ThinClients.
        And, if the current user has no attached ThinClients then one is created. Current user is the owner of the parent virtual machine.

        All tasks that needs a remote Job will be given this job.

        Specified by:
        getRemoteJob in interface Workload
        Returns:
        current workload's remote Job
